definition: continuing for a very long time; happening again and again
living for two years or more
similar in some way to another thing or situation and therefore able to be compared with it
a comparison of one thing with another thing that has similar features; a feature that is similar
the process of comparing one thing with another thing that has similar features in order to explain it
a situation in a country, an organization, etc. in which there is no government, order or control
providing necessary support to the main work or activities of an organization
in addition to something else but not as important
any one of the twelve men that Christ chose to tell people about him and his teachings
a person who strongly believes in a policy or an idea and tries to make other people believe in it
an island made of coral and in the shape of a ring with a lake of seawater (called a lagoon) in the middle
to end a pregnancy early in order to prevent a baby from developing and being born alive
to give birth to a child or young animal too early for it to survive
to end or cause something to end before it has been completed, especially because it is likely to fail
a person who is very interested in something and spends a lot of time doing it
a person who approves of something and shows enthusiasm for it
very small in size or amount
a way of referring to children when somebody wants, or is going to have, a baby
a disease, especially of children, that causes a high temperature and many spots on the skin
a small European bird of the finch family
made cool by a current of air
to walk for pleasure, especially in the countryside
to talk about somebody/something in a confused way, especially for a long time
to grow in many different directions, especially over other plants or objects
the act of treating somebody in a cruel and unfair way, especially because of their race, religion or political beliefs
the act of deliberately annoying somebody all the time and making their life unpleasant
deserving pity or causing you to feel pity
not deserving respect
connected with the education of children between the ages of about five and eleven
main; most important; basic
developing or happening first; earliest
a person who gets annoyed easily, often an old person
a drug that is used illegally for pleasure
a drug that is taken by a person or given to an animal to affect their performance in a race or sport
a stupid person
information on somebody/something, especially details that are not generally known
the highest stage of development or the most excellent example of something
to take money out of a bank account
to move back or away from a place or situation; to make somebody/something do this
to stop taking part in an activity or being a member of an organization; to stop somebody/something from doing these things
to stop giving or offering something to somebody
to say that you no longer believe that something you previously said is true
to become quieter and spend less time with other people
a person who votes or has the right to vote, especially in a political election
